title: Maxim Gorky
summary: Alexei Maximovich Peshkov (Russian: Алексей Максимович Пешков[lower-alpha 1] 28 March [O.S. 16 March] 1868 – 18 June 1936), primarily known as Maxim Gorky (Russian: Максим Горький), was a Russian writer and political activist.[1] He was nominated five times for the Nobel Prize in Literature.[2] Before his success as an author, he traveled widely across the Russian Empire changing jobs frequently, experiences which would later influence his writing.
